page.title: 11R.A.F. COSFORD
page.content: The main provisions in this section R.A.F. Cosford are the sporting facilities,the housing for the airmen, officers and the old hospital.The air men live in the married quarters for three years.The houses are mostly modern brick semi detached houses with a tiled roof.The officers' houses are separated from the airmen's quarters by the A41. The officers' houses have larger gardens and more rooms. A short while ago the most important feature was the hospital which was built in 1940 and opened by the Duchess of Gloucester. A year later a Burns Centre was added. The Burns Centre was very important in the 2nd World war because of all the people who were burnt in crashes. The hospital was knocked down in 1977.
